How to read this calendar:

  • Things above the line are due before 8am MT on the indicated day. Things below the line are due before 2pm MT on the indicated day.
  • Numbers like “1.1–2” mean you need to read those sections in the textbook, do the associated “comprehension check” problems (see below), and submit a reading question about those sections.
  • Abbreviations:
    • “Autobio” = Mathematical autobiography (submit via Gradescope)
    • “PS” = Problem set (submit via Gradescope)
    • “WR#” = Weekly reflection form for week # (submit via Google Form)
    • “Proposal” and “Project” refer to the project
    • “Bio” = Mathematical biography (submit via Gradescope)
    • “FR” = Final reflection (submit via Gradescope)

Readings, Problems, Etc

Week 1, Tuesday

  • Topic: Sets, Induction, Binomial Theorem
  • Read: A Rapid Introduction to Sets, and 1.1–2
  • Comprehension check (CC): (1.1) 1, 2, (1.2) 1(a)
  • Summary videos and notes:
    • Induction and notes
    • Strong induction and notes
    • Binomal theorem and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • Further practice (FP): (1.1) 3, 6, 7, 13, (1.2) 3

Week 1, Wednesday

  • Topics: Early Number Theory, Division Algorithm
  • Read: 2.1–2
  • CC: (2.1) 1, (2.2) 1, 2
  • Summary video and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (2.1) 2, 7, (2.2) 3, 4, 5

Week 1, Thursday

  • Topic: Greatest Common Divisors
  • Read: 2.3–4
  • CC: (2.3) 2(a), 3, 4(a), 12, (2.4) 1
  • Summary videos and notes:
    • Divisibility and notes
    • GCD (parts 1 and 2) and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (2.3) 2(b-d), 4(b-e), 6, 7, (2.4) 2, 4(a,b), 11

Week 1, Friday

  • Topic: Diophantine \(ax + by = c\)
  • Read: 2.5
  • CC: (2.5) 1, 2
  • Summary video (parts 1, 2, and 3) and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (2.5) 4, 6

Week 2, Monday

  • Topic: Primes
  • Read: 3.1–2 (3.3 is optional)
  • CC: (3.1) 3(a), 4, 7, 12 (3.2) 1, 2
  • Summary video (parts 1, 2, 3, and 4) and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (3.1) 3(b-e), 15, 17 (3.2) 5, 7, 9(a)

Week 2, Tuesday

  • Topic: Congruences
  • Read: 4.1–2
  • CC: (4.2) 1, 2, 4(a)
  • Summary video (parts 1 and 2) and notes
  • Select Reading Question Responses
  • FP: (4.2) 4(b), 5, 8, 9, 18

Week 2, Wednesday

  • Topic: Binary exponentiation, Representing bumbers
  • Read: 4.3
  • CC: (4.3) 2, 4
  • Summary video and notes
    • Binary exponentiation and notes
    • Representing numbers and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (4.3) 3, 7, 10

Week 2, Thursday

  • Topics: Linear Congruences, Chinese Remainder Theorem
  • Read: 4.4
  • CC: (4.4) 1, 4
  • Summary video and notes:
    • Linear conguences (parts 1 and 2) and notes
    • Inverses and notes
    • Chinese Remainder Theorem and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (4.4) 3, 6, 8, 15

Week 2, Friday

  • Topics: Fermat’s Little Theorem, Wilson’s Theorem
  • Read: 5.1–3 (5.4 is optional)
  • CC: (5.2) 1, 2 (5.3) 1, 3
  • Summary video and notes:
    • Wilson’s theorem and notes
    • Fermat’s little theorem (parts 1 and 2) and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (5.2) 4, 5, 6(a), 11(a) (5.3) 4(a)

Week 3, Monday

  • Topic: Euler’s \(\phi\) function
  • Read: 7.1–2 and 7.4
    • Note: We’ve skipped chapter 6. The one piece of terminology from chapter 6 that you’ll need for this reading is the definition of a multiplicative function, but the definition is easy: a function \(f\) defined on the natural numbers is multiplicative if \(f(mn) = f(m)f(n)\) whenever \(\textrm{gcd}(m,n) = 1\). Also note the Möbius inversion formula is another thing that’s discussed in chapter 6. Theorem 7.8 in section 7.4 is an application of this formula, so feel free to skip theorem 7.8.
  • CC: (7.2) 1, 4(a,b)
  • Summary video (parts 1 and 2) and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (7.2) 4(c-e), 6, 10, 11(a)

Week 3, Tuesday

  • Topic: Euler’s formula
  • Read: 7.3
  • CC: (7.3) 2, 4, 9
  • Summary video (parts 1 and 2) and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (7.3) 3, 7

Week 3, Wednesday

  • Topics: Order Modulo \(n\), Primitive Roots
  • Read: 8.1–2
  • CC: (8.1) 1, 2 (8.2) 1, 2, 4
  • Summary video and notes
    • Order (parts 1 and 2) and notes
    • Primitive roots for primes and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (8.1) 4 (8.2) 3, 5, 6

Week 3, Thursday

  • Topics: Finding Primitive Roots
  • Read: 8.3
  • CC: (8.3) 1, 2(a,b)
    • Note: For 2(b), I would ignore the hint…
  • Summary video (parts 1, 2, and 3) and notes
  • Select reading question responses
  • FP: (8.3) 3
